snippet.title: Coast child rapist will probably die in prison
snippet.content:
A SUNSHINE Coast man who raped his nine-year-old step-granddaughter and sexually abused his eight-year-old step-granddaughter is expected to be in prison or under a suspended sentence until his death.
The 72-year-old bowel cancer patient, who cannot be named to protect the identity of his victims, appeared in Maroochydore District Court yesterday for sentencing on three counts of rape and six counts of indecent treatment of a child under 12 in his care.
Doctors have estimated he has 30 months to live, and the man will spend 10 of those months in prison, after which his sentence will be suspended until August 2021.
The elderly man sat in the prisoner's dock, dressed in a blue jumper and slacks as judge Gary Long made the sentencing remarks.
Mr Long said the man took advantage of the girls' vulnerability and the family's trust in the offences committed from April to June, 2015.
"(The girls) themselves indicated this was not isolated offending," Mr Long said.
The court heard the man digitally raped the older girl three times, made her kiss him and touch his genitals, and took baths with her in which his genitals touched her.
He also touched the younger girl's genitals while she was sitting on his lap.
Mr Long also took the man's early guilty plea, his age and his deteriorating health into consideration in the sentencing.
The man's family sat in the courtroom's public gallery during the proceedings.
